abstract: Mitt Romney's decision not to pursue presidency for third time was motivated largely by lack of support from Republican Party leaders and donors, who are keen to enlist new face who can mount strong challenge to Hillary Rodham Clinton; Romney's early exit has set off battle for his donors among other aspirants, but foils Democrats hopes for protracted battle between Romney and Jeb Bush, which could have been damaging to party.
lead_paragraph: By not pursuing a third presidential bid, Mitt Romney frees up scores of donors and operatives who had been awaiting his decision.

byline.contributor: Michael Barbaro and Nicholas Confessore contributed reporting.
byline.original: By ASHLEY PARKER and JONATHAN MARTIN

snippet: By not pursuing a third presidential bid, Mitt Romney frees up scores of donors and operatives who had been awaiting his decision.

headline.main: Support Waning, Romney Decides Against 2016 Bid
headline.print_headline: Support Waning, Romney Decides Against 2016 Bid
